intro: Satureja provincialis, commonly known as the provincial savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pinkish to white flowers in the summer months. Its leaves are fragrant and contain essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja provincialis thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable plant for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
